intro: Schiedeella sparsiflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered schiedeella, is a rare and unique plant native to the humid rainforests of northeastern Australia. It is a small, evergreen shrub characterized by its compact growth habit and glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, pale green to white flowers arranged in dense, terminal clusters, which bloom during the wet season. Schiedeella sparsiflora is notable for its ability to thrive in shaded, moist environments and its role in the ecological diversity of its habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
